text: (light music)
- When I first joined, I didn't even have
to set up my alarm.

I just wake up very early,
excited to go to work.

- I still remember when they
welcomed me on my first day.

They said, ah, it's
always day one at Amazon.
And I was like, why do they all say that?
- AWS and Amazon are innovation company
and we hire builders

- Our industry in general
is very, very dynamic.

- What we work on should
be something innovative,
creative and hasn't been done before.
So every day is a day one.

- AWS really appreciate if
you are bringing something
that will help your customer,
bringing those innovation into the role.
- In AWS, particularly in data centers,
we get to do fun stuff.

We get to go around, fix things,
do things with our hands.
It really is hands on operations work.
- I need to have multiple skill sets.
It could be around the entire industries,
the market as well as the technical

and people development
and relation skills.
- And AWS, it's all about learning.

- We operate in an
environment where learning

is really important to
us so no day is the same.

- It's amazing how it's
been two and a half years
in the job, and I'm still learning.

- Every single person in the
company seeks for that growth

in terms of caring about
our, not only our customers,

but to the world, to, you
know, to the environment.
- It's a very fascinating world.
It's a very dynamic industry.
- And that's amazing.

And the impact that it
reached the entire society,
the community, has been phenomenal.
- The most exciting part at AWS in my role

is the ability to balance
the day one culture
while keeping work life balance.
- I enjoy working for AWS.
I work hard and,

but I also can enjoy
flexibility to disconnect,
spend quality time with my family.

- [Narrator] Our people are
at the heart of what we do.
- It really is always day one.
You learn something new every single day.
It's exciting, thrilling to have that kind

of environment as something
that I look forward to
every day when I work at AWS.
(upbeat music)
